author: .vbuterin
content: For the tree specification, using something that maps directly to SSZ hashing (it's not hard really, eg. SSZ hashing an array really is just a simple binary tree, with an extra leaf at the top level for the length) actually could be a good idea

author: .vbuterin
content: See allcoredevs discussion; there's benefits in starting to SSZ'ify certain pieces as the Merkle branches all become much more standardized and cleaner

author: pipermerriam
content: Curious to hear other people's thoughts on this. Since ssz is also well defined and includes merklization, it seems that using ssz would simplify the spec and let us lean on existing tools.
